results.title: The Brotherhood of St Laurence
results.creator_credit: Brotherhood of St Lawrence Production Co
results.brief_description: The Brotherhood, which is based in Melbourne, works for a better deal for disadvantaged people. This documentary describes the Brotherhood’s beginnings; its current welfare services, including accommodation for older people, a material aid service, and a sheltered workshop; its support for other independent groups; and its involvement in social issues.

results.title: On guard
results.creator_credit: Susan Lambert, Digby Duncan and Red Heart Pictures
results.brief_description: A fast moving adventure about four women who conspire to sabotage the research program of Utero, a multinational firm engaged in reproductive engineering. They plan a midnight raid on Utero’s heavily guarded plant and as the time for the raid approaches, tensions between the four saboteurs increase.

results.title: Image makers (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ursula Kolbe and Institute of Early Childhood Studies (Waverley, N.S.W.)
results.brief_description:
Looks at the way children make images and how this helps them explore and cope with the world at large, giving it order and meaning.

Includes footage from the Murawina Aboriginal Education Centre in Redfern, Sydney.

results.title: East meets West
results.brief_description: West is a theatre company made up of actors, musicians and directors. In this program, the members of the company are working together with a Melbourne Vietnamese community and have devised a play which is intended as a welcome to Vietnamese immigrants in Australia. Scenes from rehearsals and excerpts from the performances are included.

results.title: Mice Milking
results.brief_description:
Please be advised: this film contains scenes of animal restraint that some viewers may find disturbing.

This film, made by the Victorian Department of Agriculture, documents the process by which mice are milked in a laboratory at the Safe Research Farm in Werribee, for use in cancer research. The narrator explains that in mice, leukemia and mammary cancer are similar to cancer in humans and the virus is present in their milk. The mice milking machine in use in the film was developed by research officer Graeme Mein for demonstration in an open day at Werribee, based on those used by the National Cancer Institute, USA. The film shows laboratory technicians attaching a mouse to the machine and milking them.
